channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Covid: Rise in unvaccinated pregnant women ill with Covid
item.description: Wales' Chief Medical Officer Dr Frank Atherton says pregnant women should get a Covid jab.

item.title: Planes turned into graffiti canvasses by street artist
item.description: Street artist Jim Vision had an idea for what to do with planes that have ended their flying days.

item.title: Gleision: The mining disaster still affecting rescuers 10 years on
item.description: Rescue workers at the Gleision colliery disaster recall the operation 10 years on.

item.title: Covid vaccine and test passes to be introduced in Wales
item.description: People will need to show they have been vaccinated or had a negative test for clubs and large events.

item.title: Covid passports in Wales: How do I get one and how will they work?
item.description: Covid passes will need to be shown for clubs and large events from 11 October.

item.title: Reid Steele: Toddler died after being 'submerged in water'
item.description: An inquest into the death of a two year old has been opened.

item.title: Developer cleared of deliberately chopping trees in Swansea
item.description: Fiorenzo Sauro's conviction over 72 trees quashed - but appeal over cutting down giant redwood fails.

item.title: Covid: Intensive care struggling as hospital admissions rise
item.description: An intensive care consultant says all departments are "terribly stretched" from a rise in patients.

item.title: Deeside: Shotton paper mill development to create jobs
item.description: Turkish firm Eren Holding bought Shotton Mill from UPM earlier this year.

item.title: Denbigh: Hopes and fears over abandoned asylum flats plans
item.description: Plans to restore the building have been welcomed, but some fear homes will place pressure on services.

item.title: Covid: Wife calls for Wales-inquiry after husband's suicide
item.description: Running a care home during the pandemic contributed to Vernon Hough's suicide, his widow says.

item.title: Machen: Biker Ian Edwards dies after being hit by a car
item.description: Ian Edwards, 50, was pronounced dead at the scene and his family are being supported.

item.title: Covid Passes to be compulsory at 'high risk' venues in Wales
item.description: The pass confirms your vaccination status or negative lateral flow test within the previous 48 hours.

item.title: Covid: Care homes were on their own, says widow
item.description: Running a care home during the pandemic contributed to Vernon Hough's suicide, his widow says.

item.title: Disused Carmarthenshire quarry 'needs to be protected'
item.description: There are fears wildlife will be harmed if a recycling faciity is developed at the site.

item.title: Electric cars: 'People with sight loss are in danger'
item.description: Blind and visually impaired people say quiet hybrid and electric vehicles put their lives in danger.

item.title: Covid: Doctor combating jab myths called Dr Death by trolls
item.description: Dr Bnar Talabani uses social media to dispel vaccine misinformation.

item.title: Care home owners fear legal action over Covid could cause bankruptcy
item.description: Care home owners fear homes could face closure without the same protection from claims as the NHS.

item.title: Women's World Cup qualifier: Wales 6-0 Kazakhstan
item.description: Wales start their 2023 Women's World Cup qualifying campaign in a convincing win over Kazakhstan at Llanelli's Parc y Scarlets.

item.title: World Cup qualifiers: Wales boss Gemma Grainger toasts maiden victory - with cup of tea
item.description: Gemma Grainger pledges to celebrate with a cup of tea after Wales side claim a 6-0 win over Kazakhstan in her first competitive game in charge.

item.title: Ryan Elias continues rivalry with Ken Owens, Welsh rugby's 'Benjamin Button'
item.description: A new season looms, but it will be the same old challenge for Scarlets and Wales hooker Ryan Elias as he attempts to dislodge Ken Owens.

item.title: Welsh sports fans will need to show Covid passes from October
item.description: Sport fans will need to show a pass proving they have been fully vaccinated or had a negative Covid test to attend large-scale events in Wales from 11 October.

item.title: Rubin Colwill: Fellow Cardiff City midfielder will benefit from up and down week, says Marlon Pack
item.description: Cardiff City midfielder Marlon Pack believes teenager Rubin Colwill will benefit from "the trials and tribulations of Championship football".

item.title: Annog merched beichiog i gael brechiad Covid-19
item.description: Rhybudd fod nifer y merched beichiog heb eu brechu sydd nawr angen triniaeth ysbyty am Covid yn cynyddu.

item.title: Digwyddiad i ddangos 'undod' yn dilyn fandaliaeth Parc Bute
item.description: Bydd digwyddiad yn y parc ddydd Sadwrn yn "ymateb positif" ar Ã´l i 50 coeden gael eu torri yng Nghaerdydd.

item.title: Cyflwyno 'pasbort Covid' yng Nghymru o fis nesaf
item.description: Bydd angen i bobl dros 18 oed ddangos prawf o fod wedi cael brechlyn neu brawf negatif er mwyn mynd i rai lleoliadau.

item.title: Gemau rhagbrofol Cwpan y Byd 2023: Cymru 6-0 Kazakhstan
item.description: Dechrau rhagorol i ymgyrch Cymru yn rowndiau rhagbrofol Cwpan y Byd 2023 wedi buddugoliaeth hawdd.
